articles.title: DPRK FM Spokesman Accuses U.S. of Pulling up DPRK over Issue of Religious Freedom
articles.content:
DPRK FM Spokesman Accuses U.S. of Pulling up DPRK over Issue of Religious Freedom
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry gave the following answer to the question put up by KCNA Friday as regards the fact that the U.S. pulled up the DPRK over the issue of religious freedom:
					 The publication of the "2015 International Religious Freedom Report" by the U.S. Department of State more clearly proved that the U.S., the sworn enemy of the Korean people, remains unchanged in its hostile intention to destabilize the DPRK and bring down its social system at any cost under the pretext of "protection of human rights" and "freedom of religion."
					
					 The U.S. has already lost elementary qualifications to talk about human rights as it has outrageously interfered in the internal affairs of sovereign states in various parts of the world and infringed upon the sovereignty of other countries and nations under the deceptive signboard of "protection of human rights" and "democracy."
					
					 Finding it hard to bring down the DPRK by force of arms, the U.S is now making last-ditch efforts to tarnish its international image and stir up the atmosphere of putting international pressure on it by kicking up the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket.
					
					 Under this situation the DPRK will bolster up in every way its self-defensive military capabilities with nuclear deterrence as a pivot in order to safeguard its power and the revolution.

articles.title: 9th Congress of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League to Be Held
articles.content:
9th Congress of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League to Be Held
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Friday published a "notice on convening the 9th Congress of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League".
					 According to the notice, the congress is to be held in Pyongyang from August 26, Juche 105 (2016).
					
					 It will analyze and review successes and experience gained in the work of the youth league in the period under review and discuss the issues arising in further strengthening the youth league as reliable reserves, advancing group and wing of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) as required by the main spirit of the Seventh Congress of the WPK.
					
					 It stressed that the congress would strikingly demonstrate the steadfast faith and will of five million members of the young vanguard to showcase the might of the youth power of Mt. Paektu and glorify the great era of the Workers' Party as the greatest heyday of the youth movement under the uplifted banner of modeling the whole society on Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Leaves
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Japan Nagano Prefectural People's Council for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea led by Chairman Tomohiko Murayama left here for home Friday.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Palestinian President
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Palestinian President
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from Mahmoud Abbas, president of the State of Palestine, on the 71st anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 Ibrahim Abu Mualik, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Palestinian Embassy here, conveyed the floral basket to an official concerned on Friday.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Nigerian President
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Nigerian President
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from Muhammadu Buhari, president and commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, on the 71st anniversary of liberation of Korea.
					 Amos Elisha, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Nigerian Embassy in the DPRK, handed the floral basket to an official concerned on Friday.
					
					 A congratulatory letter to Kim Jong Un from the charge d'affaires ad interim of the Nigerian Embassy was also handed over.

articles.title: Pyongyang Taedonggang Beer Fest Opens
articles.content:
Pyongyang Taedonggang Beer Fest Opens
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Taedonggang Beer Fest opened on Friday.
					 On show are rice beer of highest quality, dark beer and several other kinds of beer brewed at the Taedonggang Beer Factory.
					
					 The restaurant boat Taedonggang and the wharf, venues of the beer fest, are brightly decorated with peculiar electric lighting and a large electronic display.
					
					 An opening ceremony took place on Friday.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were officials, working people, beer fans, foreign guests and overseas Koreans.
					
					 Choe Yong Nam, director of the General Bureau of Public Service who doubles as chairman of the preparatory committee for the fest, said in an opening address that the fest would be a good opportunity in spurring the competitiveness of the Taedonggang beer.
					
					 The art group of the restaurant boat Taedonggang gave a performance.
					
					 There was a beer sampling competition, revving up the festive mood.
					
					 The fest goes on.

articles.title: Performance of Revolutionary Opera Goes On in DPRK
articles.content:
Performance of Revolutionary Opera Goes On in DPRK
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The performance of the revolutionary opera "Victory of the revolution is in sight", produced by the Phibada Opera Troupe, is going on at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre in the DPRK.
					 The opera is set in 1940s, an arduous period in the history of the anti-Japanese armed struggle staged by the Korean people.
					
					 It vividly represents that a revolutionary should remain unchanged in maintaining the faith and make his or her whole life honorable in upholding the idea and cause of the leader.
					
					 "Victory of the revolution is in sight" was also adapted for a dance in the DPRK.

articles.title: National University Students Sports Contest Closes
articles.content:
National University Students Sports Contest Closes
Hamhung, August 12 (KCNA) -- A national university students sports contest for September 5 Prize closed with due ceremony in Hamhung Friday.
					 The students selected from universities and colleges of all provinces competed in the defence sports, football, basketball, volleyball, Taekwon-Do and other sports events.
					
					 Pyongyang City placed the first in the total standings.

articles.title: Reunification Vanguard of KCTU Launch Activities against Traitorous Rule
articles.content:
Reunification Vanguard of KCTU Launch Activities against Traitorous Rule
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The reunification vanguard of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) entered into actions opposing the deployment of THAAD and demanding a conclusion of a peace treaty, according to a south Korean paper.
					 The reunification vanguard started activities in Pusan on August 8.
					
					 That day the participants conducted information service, exposing the unreasonable decision on THAAD deployment and informing Pusan citizens of an importance of the conclusion of a peace treaty.
					
					 That evening the reunification vanguard took part in a candlelight rally of Ulsan citizens against the puppet regime's decision on THAAD deployment.
					
					 At the rally the participants said THAAD is a weapon serving the U.S. only, calling upon all citizens to turn out in the actions against the deployment of THAAD in order to achieve peace on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The reunification vanguard will reportedly arrive in Seoul on August 15 via Songju and Asan and take part in the August 15 event for reunification.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung, Legendary Hero of Korean Nation
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung, Legendary Hero of Korean Nation
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was a legendary hero who liberated Korea from Japan's colonial rule by leading 20 year-long anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory.
					 During the struggle, many legends praising Kim Il Sung were spread among Koreans. 
					
					 A Japanese book "Pacific War History" said that Kim Il Sung was well-known and admired even among children in the southern part of Korea under the strict control of the Japanese gendarme and police, adding: For this reason, the Japanese imperialists' rule over Korea was already put on the verge of final collapse before Japan's defeat.
					
					 A platoon leader of Japan's Kwantung Army, at that time, confessed that punitive forces suffered the repeated defeats in any battles against the anti-Japanese guerrillas led by General Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 He continued:
					
					 Later, I came to know that General Kim Il Sung was only twenty-three years old at that time, and I could not but admire him as a hero of the century for enjoying a fame as a political and military genius all over the continent at his young age.
					
					 The then vice-chief of the Hyesan police station, who was also the head of a special guard force, wrote in his memoirs about the battle on Mt. Kouyushui that he, flatting down on the ground in the thick of the battle, happened to see General Kim Il Sung through his telescope. Nobody but General Kim Il Sung, an outstanding brilliant commander, could fight and command the battle in the trench with his soldiers, he added.
					
					 Indeed, President Kim Il Sung was an outstanding military strategist and a legendary hero who defeated the strong Japanese imperialist aggression army and made a new history of national liberation struggle in colonial countries.

articles.title: Energy-saving Architecture Encouraged in DPRK
articles.content:
Energy-saving Architecture Encouraged in DPRK
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Energy-saving architecture is gaining momentum with the development of zero energy and zero carbon architecture in the DPRK.
					 In this regard, Kim Kum Song, director of the Green Architectural Institute under the State Academy of Sciences, told KCNA:
					
					 The institute was inaugurated in accordance with the noble intention of Supreme leader Kim Jong Un to develop ultra-modern architectural technologies.
					
					 It is not long after its inauguration, but has made achievements conducive to increasing the country's wealth by solving a number of sci-tech problems.
					
					 The institute, in particular, has achieved successes in the research into setting a standard of skyscraper designing in conformity with the global trends.
					
					 It set indices to zero energy and zero carbon buildings and has solved theoretical and technical problems for attaining the indices.
					
					 The achievements made by the institute have been applied to building Ryomyong Street into an energy-saving and green one.

articles.title: "Reminiscences of Participants in Fatherland Liberation War" Vol. 2 Published
articles.content:
"Reminiscences of Participants in Fatherland Liberation War" Vol. 2 Published
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out Vol. 2 of the book "Reminiscences of Participants in the Fatherland Liberation War."
					 The book carries 19 reminiscences telling the stories about the exploits President Kim Il Sung performed by leading the hard-fought Fatherland Liberation War to victory and the fighting spirit displayed by the service personnel and people of the DPRK and the heroic feats they performed by fighting for the country at the cost of their lives. 
					
					 Reminiscences entitled "Turning Adversity into Favorable Conditions" tells the story that the President put forward strategic policies to provide a turning phase in the war and overcame the harsh ordeals of the country with warm love and trust in soldiers.
					
					 Reminiscences "During Days of Armistice Talks" written like a diary recounts the story that the President victoriously led the armistice talks to victory with matchless courage and guts and brilliant political and military wisdom.
					
					 "Something More Fearful than Death," "There Would Not Be an Inch of Land to Yield to Enemy" and other reminiscences impressively tell about the Korean People's Army soldiers who bravely fought against the enemies true to the order of the supreme commander not to pardon the aggressors but wipe out them to the last one in the country.
					
					 The book also contains reminiscences telling stories about the struggle of political workers dispatched by the President to the liberated areas of south Korea and the struggle of educators to teach children even in the flames of the war.

articles.title: Korean People Will Surely Force Japan to Pay for Its Crimes down through Generations: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Korean People Will Surely Force Japan to Pay for Its Crimes down through Generations: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- It is 71 years since the defeat of the Japanese imperialists who inflicted untold misfortune and pain upon the Korean nation and other Asian people.
					 Japan is, however, adding to its past crimes, refusing to redeem its crime-woven past even now.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists invaded Korea and desperately worked to exterminate the Korean nation in a sinister bid to realize its wild dream of "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere."
					
					 The Japanese imperialists' massacres of Koreans were the most heinous and shuddering crimes against humanity that baffled human imagination.
					
					 They mercilessly killed in all brutal manners the Koreans who resisted against their invasion of Korea.
					
					 They made no scruple of reducing even peaceable inhabitants to victims of their scenario for dominating Asia.
					
					 Their massacre of Koreans in the wake of the Kanto great quake was clear evidence proving Japan's mass killings of Koreans committed out of chauvinism.
					
					 According to data of the Japanese "government-general in Korea" only, at least 23 000 Koreans were killed in the wake of the quake.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists forcibly took more than 8.4 million young and middle-aged Koreans to battle fields for aggression and slave labor sites.   They abducted 200 000 Korean women, forcing them into sexual slavery. Many of them were mercilessly killed.
					
					 They made no scruple of committing such shuddering cannibalism as eating flesh of young Koreans in shambles of war during the Pacific War.
					
					 More than a million young and middle-aged Koreans lost their lives in battle fields and slave labor sites of the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 The horrible massacres committed by the Japanese imperialists were vividly manifested in mercilessly killing 146 000 out of 200 000 Korean women forced into sexual slavery.
					
					 The massacres committed by the Japanese barbarians were the most hideous crimes against humanity unprecedented in history of any country in the world.
					
					 The unimaginably thrice-cursed massacres were not perpetrated by them during the modern times and their colonial rule over Korea only.
					
					 Their brutal massacres of Koreans dated back to the period of Koryo Kingdom when they launched invasion of it and their ferocity and brutality reached their height during the Imjin Patriotic War (1592-1598).
					
					 The shuddering massacres perpetrated by Japanese murderers throughout centuries were genocides to exterminate the Korean nation and build a criminal state, kingdom of murderers on the land of Korea.
					
					 The Japanese murderers' mass killings were unprecedentedly monstrous crimes against humanity that put into the shade the Yankees' mass killings of Indians, Hitler fascist junta's genocide of Jews in the light of organized backing from the state, persistence and scale of killings and cruelty in their methods.
					
					 Nevertheless, the Japanese reactionaries, far from making a sincere apology to the Korean people and the world for their crimes against humanity, have persistently distorted history by denying and embellishing it and pursued their policy hostile to the DPRK.
					
					 In particular, the reactionaries are resorting to anti-DPRK "human rights" racket and the moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK, hyping the "issue of abduction" which was already settled by the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration. They openly reveal their wild ambition to launch reinvasion.
					
					 All facts go to prove that Japan works hard to evade its state responsibility for making apology and reparation for all crimes committed against the Korean people, while scheming to realize at any cost the old dream of "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere" by imbuing the Japanese society with hostility toward the DPRK and militarism.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists' colonial rule over Korea ended long ago but Japan's history of unethical crimes has not ended at all.
					
					 If Japan persists in its moves for reinvasion, far from drawing a lesson from its crime-woven history, it will commit more indelible crimes against humanity to which no statue of limitation is applicable.
					
					 Gone are the days when Japan occupied and dominated other's land in a brigandish manner.
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK will surely force the sworn enemy Japan to pay dearly for its thrice-cursed crimes down through generations.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Authors Many Works Indicating Path of Korean Revolution during Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Authors Many Works Indicating Path of Korean Revolution during Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung authored lots of works during the hard-fought anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, providing a powerful ideological and theoretical weapon for achieving the historic cause of Korea's liberation.
					 He convened the meeting of leading personnel of the Young Communist League and the Anti-Imperialist Youth League in Kalun on June 30, Juche 19 (1930) where he made the report "The Path of the Korean Revolution".
					
					 In the report he clarified the truth of the revolutionary struggle that the master of the Korean revolution is the Korean people and the Korean revolution has to be carried out by the Koreans themselves to suit the specific conditions of Korea, prompted by the requirement of the times and the desire of the people and the lesson taught by the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea.
					
					 In "On Organizing and Waging Armed Struggle against Japanese Imperialism", "On the Occasion of Founding the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army", "To Spread and Develop the Armed Struggle into the Homeland" and many other works he specified the theory of building armed forces where he called on the Koreans to organize the anti-Japanese armed struggle with main emphasis on guerrilla warfare by holding arms in their own hands by their own efforts.
					
					 "On the Occasion of Forming a Party Organization", "On the Immediate Tasks of the Homeland Party Organization", "On Expanding and Strengthening the Homeland Party Organizations" and many other works also made a scientific clarification of principled issues arising in building revolutionary party organization.
					
					 The idea of building the popular and revolutionary government of new type, the unique idea advanced by the President, is comprehensively dealt with in his works such as "The People's Revolutionary Government Is Genuine People's Power", "The Ten-Point Programme of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland" and "The Inaugural Declaration of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland".
					
					 There are also many other works which give comprehensive answers to the issue of firmly consolidating the mass base of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, the issue of strengthening solidarity with the movement for emancipation of working class and oppressed nations worldwide and the international movement of people's front against fascism and the issue of widely organizing anti-Japanese patriotic organizations and enhancing their roles.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Park Geun Hye Group for Desperately Seeking Cooperation with Outsiders in Pressurizing North
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Park Geun Hye Group for Desperately Seeking Cooperation with Outsiders in Pressurizing North
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- Amid the noisy trumpeting about "nuclear and missile threat from the north" in south Korea traitor Park Geun Hye and ministers and vice-ministers of Foreign Affairs, Defense and Unification are vying with each other in staging such burlesque as imploring outside forces for cooperation in tightening "sanctions against the north."
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 This is nothing but a cynical ploy to escalate political and military pressure and economic "sanctions" against the DPRK in collusion with outsiders and thus force it to "dismantle its nukes."
					
					 The Park Geun Hye group are justifying their cooperation with outsiders in "pressurizing the north" under the pretext of coping with "provocation" and "threat" from someone. However, they can never hide their true colors as traitors.
					
					 Their solicitation diplomacy is no more than a criminal artifice to bring down the dignified socialist system in the DPRK and realize their wild ambition for achieving "unification of social systems."
					
					 They are getting ever more frantic in the anti-DPRK "sanctions," persistently taking issue with the space development for peaceful purposes and bolstering of the capability for self-defence. This, in fact, is aimed to block the building of a powerful country and bring down the socialist system in the DPRK in collusion with outside forces including the U.S.
					
					 No matter how desperately the Park group may work, they can never block the DPRK's advance nor realize their daydream of achieving "unification of social systems."
					
					 Finding themselves in the worst ruling crisis, the Park Geun Hye group are seeking closer cooperation with outsiders in "pressurizing the north" to do harm to the compatriots in the north. This frenzy would only make their position at home and abroad more difficult.

articles.title: S. Korean Broadcasting Service Ridicules Society Prevalent with Pro-Japanese Acts
articles.content:
S. Korean Broadcasting Service Ridicules Society Prevalent with Pro-Japanese Acts
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean CBS on August 5 criticized the south Korean society where sycophancy toward Japan is rampant.
					 It said that the chief of an organ in a recent public appearance made reckless remarks eulogizing the Japanese king without hesitation.
					
					 Anti-Japanese and national bodies in south Korea recently confirmed that more than 220 pro-Japanese elements were awarded 440 orders since the appearance of the puppet regime, 84 percent of which were conferred upon them during the office of traitors Syngman Rhee and Park Chung-Hee.
					
					 It was recently disclosed that the one who earned an all-fame as a Japanese policeman for arresting and torturing participants in the independence movement during the period of the Japanese imperialists' rule over Korea was presented with three orders in the period of Syngman Rhee's rule.
					
					 All successive dictators of south Korea regarded pro-Japanese acts as means of their existence without exception.

articles.title: S. Korean Enterprises Demand Regime Compensate for Losses Incurred by Shut-down of KIZ
articles.content:
S. Korean Enterprises Demand Regime Compensate for Losses Incurred by Shut-down of KIZ
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean emergency measure committee for Kaesong Industrial Zone (KIZ) on Aug. 11 declared its stand to wage a strenuous struggle in demand of the puppet authorities' compensation for the losses, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 A spokesman for the south Korean Ministry of Unification said on Aug. 10 that it is nonsensical to argue about the re-starting of the KIZ due to the "provocation and threat from the north."
					
					 The Ministry turned down two applications made by the organization for visiting Kaesong in last June under the absurd pretext that "it was not appropriate to do so in consideration of the present inter-Korean relations."
					
					 Infuriated by this, the organization held a rally before the puppet "government" building in demand of the compensation for the losses caused by the shut-down of KIZ at which it said it would make another application for visit to Kaesong.

articles.title: Signature-campaign under Way in Protest against Deployment of THAAD
articles.content:
Signature-campaign under Way in Protest against Deployment of THAAD
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A signature-campaign is now under way in the U.S. and abroad, urging the U.S. administration to retract its decision for deploying THAAD in south Korea, according to the south Korean News 1.
					 As of Wednesday, more than 103 250 persons took part in the campaign which started through a website of the White House on July 15.
					
					 The sponsor of the campaign said that the U.S. and south Korean authorities decided to deploy THAAD in south Korea despite the south Korean people's strong protest, adding that their decision would escalate the tension on the Korean peninsula and in its vicinity.
					
					 He stressed that now is the time to ensure lasting peace on the Korean peninsula and in its vicinity through negotiations.

articles.title: Russian Organization Praises DPRK as Youth Power
articles.content:
Russian Organization Praises DPRK as Youth Power
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is, indeed, the country of youth with rosy future and youth power without an equal in the world.
					 The Rostov Association for the Study of Kimilsungism－Kimjongilism of Russia said this in an article titled "Youth Power" posted on a website on Aug. 6.
					
					 The article said:
					
					 The 9th Congress of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League is to be held in the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK which is demonstrating its dignity as the politico-ideological power and military power is also called youth power.
					
					 The society is pulsating and making rapid progress thanks to the inexhaustible strength of the youths who are sound and united in thinking and spirit and full of passion and has, therefore, a rosy future. Such country can be called youth power.
					
					 Youth power means a real powerful nation. 
					
					 However vast territory and large population a country has and how wealthy it is, it has no future if its young people are ideologically and morally sick.
					
					 The DPRK is making a steady leap forward thanks to its youths' vanguard role.
					
					 Today when the youths' mental and moral corruption is posing itself as a serious social problem in many countries and the young people are taking the road of corruption and crimes, imbued with the individualist view on life, the DPRK youths' noble mental and moral traits are giving a profound impact on the international community.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Malaysia
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Malaysia
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- A seminar took place in Malaysia on Aug. 6 on the 71st anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 The secretary general of the Malaysian preparatory committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu said:
					
					 I extend warm congratulations to the Korean people on the 71st anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					 On this day I pay high tribute to President Kim Il Sung, the eternal leader of the Korean people who liberated Korea from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule.
					
					 The President who embarked upon the road of revolution in his teens founded the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and led the arduous anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory, achieving Korea's liberation.
					
					 Korea's liberation, an event to be specially recorded in history, marked an epochal occasion in carving out the destiny of the Korean people.
					
					 I wish the Korean people bigger successes in the building of a socialist power.

articles.title: Peruvian Radio Praises Kim Il Sung for Liberating Korea
articles.content:
Peruvian Radio Praises Kim Il Sung for Liberating Korea
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Radio Cielo aired a program introducing the DPRK on Aug. 7 on the 71st anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 The radio cited concrete facts to condemn the Japanese imperialists for imposing unbearable misfortune and pain on the Korean people for more than 40 years of colonial rule after occupying it by force of arms early in the last century.
					
					 It praised President Kim Il Sung for putting an end to the Japanese imperialists' harsh colonial rule and achieving the liberation of Korea through 20 years-long bloody anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
					
					 The chief of the Radio Station in radio appearance extended warm congratulations to the Korean people on the 71st anniversary of Korea's liberation, which was of great historic significance for them.
					
					 The chief went on to say:
					
					 The Korean people's struggle for national liberation and its victory powerfully encouraged the national liberation struggle of the people in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 That's why this great exploits will last forever along with human history.
					
					 Today the U.S. and its followers are ratcheting up the sanctions and blockade against the DPRK.
					
					 But Korean socialism is making a dynamic advance under the wise guidance of the respected Comrade Kim Jong Un.
					
					 I am convinced that the just cause of the Korean people is sure to triumph.

articles.title: Pakistani Internet Magazine Observes Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Revolutionary Leadership
articles.content:
Pakistani Internet Magazine Observes Anniversary of Kim Jong Il 's Start of Songun Revolutionary Leadership
Pyongyang, August 12 (KCNA) -- The August issue of the Pakistani internet magazine Global Affairs dedicated five pages to the 56th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 It carries photos of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 An article titled "World should know about DPRK, nuclear power" said that Juche Korea succeeded in H-bomb test and launching the earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-4 in January and February. The U.S. and its followers are slapping sanctions against the DPRK but they can never overpower its might and the world should know about the DPRK, nuclear power, it added.
					
					 Another article titled "Songun brilliant commander and socialist Korea" said:
					
					 August 25 is the day when Kim Jong Il, leader of the DPRK, started his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 He directed primary efforts to strengthening the Korean People's Army under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea's line of simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force serves as the most just one for defusing the danger of a nuclear war prevailing on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Thanks to this just line the DPRK had access to the strongest nuclear deterrence and ranked itself among nuclear powers.
					
					 The U.S. and its followers are much afraid of the DPRK's nuclear deterrence.
					
					 If the U.S. tries to ignite a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula, the ultra-modern strike means of the DPRK will open fire first.
					
					 The DPRK has solemnly declared that the right to mount a preemptive nuclear strike is by no means a monopoly of the U.S.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe cesto de flores enviado por el Presidente palestino
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe cesto de flores enviado por el Presidente palestino
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Presidente Kim Jong Un recibio un cesto de flores que le enviara el Presidente del Estado de Palestina, Mahmoud Abbas, con motivo del aniversario 71 de la liberacion de Corea. 
					El encargado de negocios a.i. palestino en Corea, Ibrahim Abu Mualik, lo entrego este viernes a un funcionario coreano.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe cesto de flores enviado por presidente nigeriano
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe cesto de flores enviado por presidente nigeriano
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Presidente Kim Jong Un recibio un cesto de flores que le enviara Muhammadu Buhari, Presidente de la Republica Federal de Nigeria y comandante en jefe de las fuerzas armadas, con motivo de 71o aniversario de la liberacion de Corea.
					El encargado de negocios a.i. de Nigeria en Corea, Amos Elisha, lo traslado el dia 12 a un funcionario coreano.
					
					Fue entregada tambien la carta de felicitacion de ese diplomatico nigeriano dedicada al Presidente.

articles.title: Portavoz de MINREX de RPDC refuta el "informe sobre libertad religiosa" de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Portavoz de MINREX de RPDC refuta el "informe sobre libertad religiosa" de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- A la pregunta de un reportero de la ACNC formulada el dia 12 en relacion con que los Estados Unidos cuestiono el problema de la libertad religiosa de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del MINREX de la RPDC dio la siguiente respuesta:
					La publicacion del "informe sobre la libertad religiosa internacional de 2015" por parte del Departamento de Estado norteamericano mostro fehacientemente el invariable intento hostil de EE.UU. para desintegrar el interior de la RPDC y derrocar a toda costa su regimen bajo el pretexto de la "defensa de DDHH" y la "libertad religiosa".
					
					Ahora, EE.UU. interviene brutalmente en los asuntos internos de los Estados soberanos y viola y suprime la soberania de otros paises y naciones bajo el enganoso pretexto de la "defensa de DDHH" y la "democracia", razon por la cual ya perdio la calidad elemental de hablar de los derechos humanos.
					
					Ya que EE.UU. no puede hacer nada mas en lo militar contra la RPDC, hace desesperados esfuerzos para manchar la imagen internacional de la RPDC y recrudecer mas el ambiente de sancion y presion internacionales anti-RPDC mediante el fortalecimiento de los alborotos de "DDHH".
					
					Mientras no se cambia en lo minimo el intento hostil de EE.UU., enemigo jurado, encaminado a derrocar el regimen de la RPDC, esta centuplicara de todas las maneras sus capacidades militares autodefensivas apoyadas en el disuasivo nuclear para salvaguardar el Poder y la revolucion.

articles.title: Inaugurado Festival de Cerveza Taedonggang de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Inaugurado Festival de Cerveza Taedonggang de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- Comenzo el Festival de Cerveza Taedonggang de Pyongyang.
					En esta ocasion se exhibieron los productos de mejor calidad  de la Fabrica de Cerveza Taedonggang como las cervezas de arroz blanco y la negra.
					
					El barco-restaurante "Taedonggang" y el embarcadero fueron adornados elegantemente con las lamparillas y pantallas electronicas de gran tamano.
					
					El dia 12, tuvo lugar la ceremonia inaugural con la participacion de los funcionarios, trabajadores, aficionados a la cerveza, asi como los extranjeros y coreanos residentes en ultramar que se encuentran ahora en Corea.
					
					Al pronunciar el discurso de la ocasion, Choe Yong Nam, titular de la Direccion General de Servicios al Pueblo y presidente del comite preparatorio del festival, dijo que este evento sera una oportunidad significativa para elevar la competitividad de las cervezas de marca Taedonggang.
					
					Redoblo la alegria de los participantes una funcion artistica ofrecida por las miembros del grupo artistico del barco-restaurante.
					
					El ambiente de la feria llego al climax cuando se realizo la competencia de saboreo de cerveza.
					
					El festival se continua.

articles.title: ACNC revela crimenes de Japon en comentario publicado por 15 de agosto
articles.content:
ACNC revela crimenes de Japon en comentario publicado por 15 de agosto
Pyongyang, 12 de agosto (ACNC) -- Se cumplen 71 anos desde la derrota del imperialismo japones que impuso incontables sufrimientos, desgracias y desastres de guerra a la nacion coreana y los demas pueblos asiaticos. 
					Durante ese tiempo, el mundo viene marchando por la senda de independencia y civilizacion recuperandose de las lesiones historicas de la segunda guerra mundial.
					
					Pero, Japon abulta su expediente criminal sin liquidar su pasado bochornoso.
					
					Para realizar el sueno de la "esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia oriental", el imperialismo japones cometio la agresion militar a Corea y trato de exterminar la nacion coreana.
					
					La masacre de coreanos, cometida por los imperialistas japoneses, fue el mas horrible crimen antietico.
					
					Ellos asesinaron bestialmente a los coreanos que se rebelaron contra la agresion a Corea y dieron muerte hasta a los habitantes pacificos convirtiendolos en las victimas de las guerras desatadas para tomar la hegemonia en Asia. 
					
					El gran terremoto de Kanto ha sido un testimonio del extremado chovinismo nacional de Japon. En este incidente murieron mas de 23 mil coreanos residentes en Japon, segun el dato publicado por el "gobierno general de Corea". 
					
					Mas de 8 millones 400 mil jovenes y adultos coreanos fueron trasladados por la fuerza a los campos de guerra de agresion y a los puestos de trabajo de esclavitud. De esa cifra, perdieron la vida mas de un millon.
					
					200 mil coreanas se convirtieron en esclavas sexuales para el viejo ejercito japones y entre ellas, 146 mil resultaron asesinadas salvajemente. 
					
					Para colmo, en el periodo de la Guerra del Pacifico, los militares japoneses comieron la carne de los jovenes coreanos traidos a los campos de guerra. 
					
					Estos crimenes inimaginables no comenzaron en el pasado reciente o durante el coloniaje sobre Corea, sino ya en el periodo de Coryo y durante la Guerra Patriotica de Imjin.
					
					El genocidio de coreanos, que se cometio en varios siglos, persiguio la meta de exterminar a la nacion coreana y levantar sobre sus cadaveres un Estado delincuente y reino de asesinos.
					
					Es el crimen mas barbaro que la matanza de indios por EE.UU. y la caza de judios por la camarilla fascista de Hitler tanto en el caracter organizativo del Estado como en su duracion, dimension y crueldad de metodos de asesinato. 
					
					Sin embargo, lejos de pedir perdon al pueblo coreano y el mundo por sus crimenes de lesa humanidad, los reaccionarios japoneses tergiversan la historia para hacer apologia de su pasado criminal y practican la politica de hostilidad a la RPDC. 
					
					En particular, recrudecen la campana de "DDHH" contra la RPDC pretextando el "problema de secuestro", ya solucionado segun la Declaracion Corea-Japon de Pyongyang, y tratan de aislarla y atropellarla a toda costa. 
					
					Los hechos arriba mencionados demuestran que Japon intenta eludir a toda costa la responsabilidad estatal de pedir perdon e indemnizar todos sus crimenes cometidos contra el pueblo coreano, y al mismo tiempo, realizar el sueno de "esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia oriental" al infundir en la sociedad japonesa la conciencia hostil a la RPDC y el militarismo. 
					
					La dominacion colonial del imperialismo japones sobre Corea termino hace mucho tiempo, pero continua la historia de crimenes antieticos. 
					
					Si el pais isleno persigue hasta el final la nueva agresion sin aprender la leccion de su historia ignominiosa, cometeria el crimen mas grande e imprescriptible contra la humanidad. 
					
					Ya paso el tiempo en que Japon arrebataba y dominaba territorios ajenos con metodos gangsteriles. 
					
					El ejercito y pueblo coreanos cobraran sin falta de generacion en generacion el precio de sangre derramada por culpa de Japon, enemigo jurado.
